thread.title: So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now
thread.title_full: So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now

title: So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now So, in true 007 style, what Daniel Craig has to say about making another James Bond film might leave you a little shaken. The actor told TimeOut that he would rather die than make another Bond flick right now. Post to Facebook So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now So, in true 007 style, what Daniel Craig has to say about making another James Bond film might leave you a little shaken. The actor told TimeOut that he would rather die than make another Bond flick right now. Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1LjHVFA Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs So Daniel Craig is TOTALLY over the James Bond thing for now USA Today, USAToday.com 8:19 a.m. EDT October 8, 2015 British actor Daniel Craig poses during a photocall to promote the 24th James Bond film 'Spectre' on February 18, 2015 at Rome's city hall. (Photo: TIZIANA FABI/AFP/Getty Images) 10 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
So, in true 007 style, what Daniel Craig has to say about making another James Bond film might leave you a little shaken. The actor told TimeOut that he would rather die than make another Bond flick right now. 
"I'd rather break this glass and slash my wrists... I'm over it at the moment. We're done. All I want to do is move on." 
Welp! Looks like someone could use a little Solace... The actor went on to say that if he reprised the role of the secret agent for a fifth time it would only be for the payday. And he doesn't necessarily care who takes over the role of Bond, James Bond, after he's done. 
"Look, I don’t give a (bleep). Good luck to them! All I care about is that if I stop doing these things we’ve left it in a good place and people pick it up and make it better. Make it better, that’s all." 
Seems like a fair request. Spectre , Craig's last Bond film (for now), hits theaters on November 6.
